page.title: 01TEWKESBURY
page.content: Tewkesbury is a quaint old market town that lies on the junction of the rivers Severn and Avon. A Norman Abbey dominates the area and along with Tewkesbury's many fine old black and white buildings, the town has become a picturesque attraction for thousands of tourists each year. Tewkesbury lies close to the M.5 motorway,thus being ideally placed for easy access from most parts of the country. The industrial areas of Tewkesbury are kept away from the town centre,and therefore do not affect its olde worlde character. The town lies in a region of outstanding beauty with such areas as the Cotswolds,the Vale of Evesham,Cheltenham and Gloucester,and the Forest of Deanbeing within easy reach.
